page.title: 15CLUBS IN SHALBOURNE
page.content: The{Kingston Room}(village hall) built in 1843 as a school, is now used for many activities including clubs. The {"Good Companions"}was formed in 1963 and has 24 members; they meet on Mondays and enjoy bingo, whist, tea and sometimes a talk with slides; 2/3 times a year, outings are arranged. {Women's Institute}meetings take place monthly with about 36 members who have talks, tea and social time; twice a year there are WI fund raising events, a{Drama Group}flourishes with annual performances for members and the village. A{badminton club}and{keep fit class are also successful. A{Brownie {pack}was formed in 1974 with 15 young- sters; apart from working for badges, they hold sales of work and give part of the proceeds towards the buying of items for the village or church. There is also a{youth badminton club.
